snippet.title: John 'Rotten' Lydon: I'm not a museum piece
snippet.description:
* John Lydon is wondering whether he's looking old. He jokes that the camera should be smeared with Vaseline to give a flattering, soft-focus effect. "Or we could use butter!" he laughs in reference to a series of TV commercials which helped to fund his band's latest album.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/10/17/showbiz/uk-john-lydon-rotten-pil/index.html

snippet.title: Texting while walking a dangerous experiment in multitasking
snippet.description:
* By Steve Kastenbaum, CNN Radio National Correspondent Listen to CNN Radio's podcast from Steve Kastenbaum about the dangers of texting while walking. The old joke about a not-so-bright person goes, “He’s so dumb, he can’t walk and chew gum at the same...
http://news.blogs.cnn.com/2012/05/26/texting-while-walking-a-dangerous-experiment-in-multitasking/

snippet.title: Tech blogs not sold on Google's 'Facebook clone'
snippet.description:
* There's an old joke in the tech world:
http://www.cnn.com/2011/TECH/social.media/06/28/google.plus.reaction/index.html

snippet.title: The Sweep: The risk of democracy in the Middle East
snippet.description:
* There is an old joke in the Middle East that goes like this: One of Hosni Mubarak's advisers finally gets the courage to say, "Mr. President, maybe it's time to think about your farewell address to the Egyptian people." Mubarak looks at the adviser and asks, "Why? Where are they going?"
http://www.cnn.com/2011/POLITICS/02/02/sweep.us.egypt/index.html

snippet.title: China's interest rate balancing act
snippet.description:
* (CNN) – There’s an old joke about economics: “If I have a foot in a bucket of hot water and a foot in a bucket of cold water, on average I’m warm!” Well that same economic principal could be applied to China right now. The government is proud of its...
http://business.blogs.cnn.com/2010/10/20/chinas-interest-rate-balancing-act/

snippet.title: How 'Seven Samurai' was saved
snippet.description:
* The process of restoring a classic film -- indeed a film considered one of the greatest in movie history -- conjures up the old joke about how to feed a hungry lion.
http://www.cnn.com/2006/SHOWBIZ/Movies/09/22/seven.samurai/index.html

snippet.title: Tell-tale signs of a tall tale
snippet.description:
* How can you tell when your lawyer is lying ? When his lips are moving -- so the old joke goes.
http://www.cnn.com/2005/US/Careers/08/12/liars/index.html

snippet.title: TechWeb: New Fed rules cost a bundle
snippet.description:
* There's an old joke with the punch line: "I'm from the federal government, and I'm here to help you." But business-technology executives at health-care and financial-services companies aren't laughing as they study new and pending laws and regulations that require them to handle data in different ways-namely, storing more...
http://www.cnn.com/2002/TECH/biztech/11/12/rules_store/index.html

snippet.title: Carson, even in retirement, casts long shadow
snippet.description:
* There's an old joke: Who has been present at the conception of more children than any other person?
http://www.cnn.com/2002/SHOWBIZ/TV/05/22/johnny.carson/index.html
